page.title: 04ROUND ISLAND NEAR ARNE
page.content: Round Island lies to the East of Arne,across the narrow Wych Channel. The wardens live an isolated life and visit the mainland only on a Thursday. They have their own boat and Thursday is the only day on which they have a paper. When the wardens are on holiday ,the island is left untended and is visited by the owner. There is no postman and mail must be collected from the GPO. There is also no dustman and all rubbish is burnt. Water is obtained from an artesian well 180 ft deep but as it has a high iron content it must be neutralized at the island's plant. Electricity and telephone services are received from the mainland: Electricity comes from near Branston Farm. The only inhabitants of Round Island are the wardens.
